result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation on Ct 2 in this same case as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall have no contact with Chad Pagenkopf  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Contact can be allowed if approved by Chad Pagenkopf and the defendant's agent.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
Restitution to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Probation on Ct 1 in this same case

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
